showScoreExcerpt:
“Will I be totally humiliated if I mess it up?” Remy asks in the Broadway premiere of How to Dance in Ohio. It’s a question that we’ve all asked ourselves, and it’s a central theme of the musical, which focuses on seven autistic young adults, portrayed by seven autistic actors, trying to make connections while preparing for a spring formal, dealing with the same types of emotions as neurotypical people but facing a world that was not built with them in mind. It gets to the heart of so much of what makes us all human, as we progress from children to teenagers to young adults.

Read more
